name: Octavia Butler
fact: Pioneering sci-fi author who tackled race, gender, and power.

name: Zora Neale Hurston
fact: Anthropologist and author of 'Their Eyes Were Watching God'.

name: Dr. Patricia Bath
fact: Invented a laser procedure for cataract treatment.

name: Guion Bluford
fact: First Black American astronaut in space.

name: Marsha P. Johnson
fact: Trans activist who helped lead the Stonewall uprising.

name: Juneteenth
fact: Marks June 19, 1865, when the last enslaved people in Texas were freed.

name: Dr. Cornel West
fact: Philosopher and activist known for work on race and justice.

name: Otis Boykin
fact: Invented electrical resistors used in computers, radios, and pacemakers.

name: Freedom Rides
fact: Integrated bus rides challenging segregation in the South.

name: Hazel Scott
fact: Jazz and classical pianist who broke racial barriers in entertainment.

name: Barack Obama
fact: First Black President of the United States.

name: Ketanji Brown Jackson
fact: First Black woman on the U.S. Supreme Court.

name: Claudette Colvin
fact: Refused to give up her seat months before Rosa Parks.

name: Edward Brooke
fact: First Black U.S. Senator since Reconstruction.

name: Angela Davis
fact: Activist, scholar, and author known for her work in prison reform and racial justice.

name: Benjamin Bradley
fact: Enslaved boy who built a working steam engine.

name: Gordon Parks
fact: Photographer and filmmaker known for documenting civil rights.

name: Rebecca Lee Crumpler
fact: First Black woman to become a doctor in the U.S.

name: Charlotte Forten Grimké
fact: First Black teacher in a white Massachusetts school.

name: 1963 March on Washington
fact: Site of MLK’s 'I Have a Dream' speech.

name: Spike Lee
fact: Filmmaker who reshaped cinema with stories about Black life and justice.

name: James Baldwin
fact: Writer and activist whose works confronted racial and social issues in America.

name: Tulsa Race Massacre
fact: Attack on the prosperous Black community of Greenwood in 1921.

name: Mary McLeod Bethune
fact: Founder of a school for Black girls and advocate for education.

name: Lonnie Johnson
fact: Inventor of the Super Soaker water gun and NASA engineer.

name: Brown v. Board of Education
fact: 1954 Supreme Court case that ended school segregation.

name: Claudette Colvin
fact: Refused to give up her seat on a segregated bus months before Rosa Parks.

name: Romare Bearden
fact: Visual artist celebrated for his vibrant collages.

name: James Armistead Lafayette
fact: Revolutionary War spy who fed intelligence to Americans.

name: Madam C.J. Walker
fact: America’s first self-made female millionaire through haircare products.

name: Jo Ann Robinson
fact: Organizer of the Montgomery Bus Boycott.

name: Bayeza Maisha
fact: Educator and poet dedicated to youth development.

name: bell hooks
fact: Cultural critic and educator known for her work on intersectionality.

name: Lucy Parsons
fact: Anarchist and labor activist born into slavery.

name: Dr. Ruth Simmons
fact: First Black president of an Ivy League university (Brown).

name: John Lewis
fact: Congressman and lifelong activist who led the march across Edmund Pettus Bridge.

name: Norbert Rillieux
fact: Revolutionized sugar refining with the multiple-effect evaporator.

name: Paulo Freire
fact: Brazilian educator whose work inspired global liberation pedagogy.

name: Septima Poinsette Clark
fact: Educator and civil rights activist who developed citizenship schools.

name: Nina Simone
fact: Singer, songwriter, and activist whose music echoed civil rights themes.

name: Bayard Rustin
fact: Key organizer of the 1963 March on Washington and advisor to Martin Luther King Jr.

name: Dr. Angela Davis
fact: Scholar and professor known for work in feminism, incarceration, and liberation.

name: Medgar Evers
fact: NAACP field secretary who fought for voting rights and was assassinated in 1963.

name: The Great Migration
fact: Mass relocation of 6 million Black Americans from the South.

name: Ella Baker
fact: Behind-the-scenes force in the civil rights movement who mentored many young activists.

name: Shirley Chisholm
fact: First Black woman elected to Congress.

name: Kehinde Wiley
fact: Painter who reimagines classical portraits with modern Black subjects.

name: Valerie Thomas
fact: NASA physicist who developed 3D imaging technology.

name: Voting Rights Act of 1965
fact: Outlawed discriminatory voting practices.

name: Mae Jemison
fact: First Black woman to travel in space.

name: Patricia Roberts Harris
fact: First Black woman in a presidential cabinet.

name: Alvin Ailey
fact: Choreographer who revolutionized modern dance.

name: Hiram Revels
fact: First Black person to serve in the U.S. Congress.

name: Langston Hughes
fact: Poet of the Harlem Renaissance and voice of Black consciousness.

name: Robert Smalls
fact: Escaped slavery and became a Civil War hero and politician.

name: Dr. Shirley Jackson
fact: Her physics research led to advances in telecommunications technology.

name: Marie Van Brittan Brown
fact: Created the first home security system.

name: Maya Angelou
fact: Renowned poet and author of 'I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings'.

name: Diane Nash
fact: Co-founder of the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee and key figure in the Freedom Rides.

name: Lewis Latimer
fact: Improved the carbon filament for the lightbulb.

name: Mary Ellen Pleasant
fact: Abolitionist and entrepreneur who funded revolts.

name: The Harlem Renaissance
fact: Explosion of Black cultural expression in the 1920s.

name: George Washington Carver
fact: Developed hundreds of products from peanuts.

name: Million Man March
fact: Historic gathering of Black men in D.C. promoting unity.

name: W.E.B. Du Bois
fact: Co-founder of the NAACP and sociologist who championed civil rights.

name: Fred Hampton
fact: Chairman of the Illinois chapter of the Black Panther Party, known for his community programs.

name: Mamie Till-Mobley
fact: Mother of Emmett Till, whose courage helped galvanize the civil rights movement.

name: The Moynihan Report Response
fact: Sparked key debates on systemic oppression.

name: Oscar Micheaux
fact: First major Black American filmmaker.

name: Augusta Savage
fact: Harlem Renaissance sculptor and arts educator.

name: Dr. John Henrik Clarke
fact: Historian and Pan-Africanist who challenged Eurocentric curricula.

name: Bessie Coleman
fact: First Black woman pilot.

name: Fannie Lou Hamer
fact: Voting rights activist and leader of the Mississippi Freedom Democratic Party.

name: Thurgood Marshall
fact: First Black U.S. Supreme Court Justice.

name: Frances Ellen Watkins Harper
fact: Abolitionist, writer, and suffragist.

name: Dr. Carter G. Woodson
fact: Father of Black History Month.

name: James Baldwin
fact: Author of 'The Fire Next Time' and major cultural critic.

name: Kimberlé Crenshaw
fact: Scholar who coined the term 'intersectionality'.

name: Dr. Molefi Kete Asante
fact: Pioneer of Afrocentric theory.

name: Benjamin Banneker
fact: Built America’s first clock and was a surveyor for Washington, D.C.

name: Jackie Robinson
fact: First Black player in Major League Baseball.

name: 1968 Olympics Black Power Salute
fact: Tommie Smith and John Carlos raised fists for civil rights.

name: Assata Shakur
fact: Former Black Liberation Army member, activist, and symbol of resistance.

name: Kara Walker
fact: Artist known for her powerful silhouette installations.

name: Kamala Harris
fact: First woman, Black and South Asian Vice President.

name: Colin Powell
fact: First Black U.S. Secretary of State.

name: Jacob Lawrence
fact: Painter who chronicled the Great Migration.

name: Garrett Morgan
fact: Invented the three-position traffic signal and gas mask.

name: Dr. Joy DeGruy
fact: Psychologist known for research on Post Traumatic Slave Syndrome.

name: Carol Moseley Braun
fact: First Black woman in the U.S. Senate.

name: Booker T. Washington
fact: Founder of Tuskegee Institute and proponent of vocational education.

name: Montgomery Bus Boycott
fact: Year-long protest sparked by Rosa Parks' arrest.

name: Black Panther Party
fact: Revolutionary organization focused on self-defense and community programs.

name: Stokely Carmichael
fact: Coined the phrase 'Black Power' and led SNCC during a crucial era.

name: The George Floyd Protests
fact: Global demonstrations against police brutality in 2020.

name: Sarah Boone
fact: Improved the ironing board for practical home use.

name: Civil Rights Act of 1964
fact: Landmark legislation prohibiting discrimination.

name: William Still
fact: Helped hundreds escape slavery via the Underground Railroad.

name: Dr. Ibram X. Kendi
fact: Historian and author of 'How to Be an Antiracist'.

name: Henrietta Lacks
fact: Her cells revolutionized medical research, often without her consent.

name: Dr. Mark Dean
fact: Co-inventor of the IBM personal computer.

name: John Mercer Langston
fact: First Black American elected to public office.

name: Anna Julia Cooper
fact: Educator and author of 'A Voice from the South'.

name: Jean-Michel Basquiat
fact: Neo-expressionist painter who explored Black identity and power.

name: Granville T. Woods
fact: Held over 50 patents and improved railroad and telegraph systems.
